intro: Columnea bicolor, commonly known as the twin-colored flame or red-and-white columnea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, red-and-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or trailing vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soil with indirect sunlight. Columnea bicolor is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation indoors.
